bibl.title: The Impact of Law on Village Life in Roman Egypt
bibl.note: How and when a villager had recourse to 'the law', and what he or she knew about the law. The investigation is limited to papyri from Soknopaiou Nesos, Tebtunis, and Oxyrhynchus from the Irst to the IIIrd cent. A.D. - Bibliography.

bibl.title: Law, Politics and Society in the Ancient Mediterranean World

bibl.seg: HOBSON Deborah W., The Impact of Law on Village Life in Roman Egypt.
Baruch HALPERN and Deborah W. HOBSON (Edd.), Law, Politics and Society in the Ancient Mediterranean World (Sheffield, 1993) pp. 193-219.

How and when a villager had recourse to 'the law', and what he or she knew about the law. The investigation is limited to papyri from Soknopaiou Nesos, Tebtunis, and Oxyrhynchus from the Irst to the IIIrd cent. A.D. - Bibliography.
